hillbillies.part3.programs

Class TaskParser<E,S,T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • hillbillies.part3.programs.TaskParser<E,S,T>

  • public class TaskParser<E,S,T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Parser for Hillbillies tasks. To use this class, first create an implementation of ITaskFactory: 
     
 ITaskFactory<MyExpression, MyStatement, Task> factory = new TaskFactory();
    The easiest way to use this class for parsing a Task given as a String is via the #parseTask(String, ITaskFactory) method: 
     
 Task task = TaskParser.parseTask(text, factory);
    For more control, create an instance of this class: 
     
 TaskParser<MyExpression, MyStatement, Task> parser = new TaskParser<>(factory);
    Finally, parse a string or file: 
     Optional<Task> parseResult = parser.parse(textToParse);
    If parsing is successful, parseResult.isPresent() returns true and parseResult.get() returns the created task. If parsing was not successful, parseResult.isPresent() returns false and parser.getErrors() can be used to retrieve the list of errors during parsing.

      • parseString

        public java.util.Optional<java.util.List<T>> parseString(java.lang.String string,
                                                         java.util.List<int[]> selectedCubes)
        Returns the tasks that results from parsing the given string, or Optional.empty() if parsing has failed. When parsing has failed, the error messages can be retrieved with the getErrors() method.
        Parameters:
        selectedCubes - The cubes which should be used as selected cubes in the created tasks.
